item.title: Your python interpreter inside a docker container with Emacs
item.description: Emacs has this very powerful package Elpy which is usually recommended if you want to code in Python. Docker can containerize your Python interpreter so that you can seemlessly run your applications on any device. In Emacs with elpy installed, C-c C-c binding (C is for Control key) runs elpy-shell-send-region-to-buffer and is very handy for running on the fly python commands for testing your code. It actually use the content of the variable python-shell-interpreter for the python interpreter.
